  Summary 

public class  PrefsEditor
     extends java.awt.Frame
{
          // Constructors 1
     public PrefsEditor();

          // Methods 3
     public boolean action(Event, Object);
     public void close();
     public boolean handleEvent(Event);
}

A dialog box to let the user edit various preferences that effect the application. Needs-More-Work: right now the only preferences that can be edited relate to redrawing. I should add prefs for handle colors, grid snap(?), and some behaviors... Needs-More-Work: This code could be deleted if I used a PropSheet to edit preferences instead.

See Also: RedrawManager

· action

Summary  |  Top 
   public boolean action(Event e, 
                         Object what)

If the use pushes one of the buttons, update Globals.prefs(). Needs-More-Work: It would be nice to have a more compact way to code this. I expect that every preference that can be edited will affect Globals.prefs() in a similiar way.
